statements: SELECT * FROM expenses ORDER BY expense_date DESC;
SELECT id, category, expense_amount FROM expenses WHERE category = 'Food';
SELECT SUM(expense_amount) AS total_expense FROM expenses WHERE expense_date = '2021-10-15';
SELECT category, COUNT(*) AS total_count FROM expenses GROUP BY category HAVING total_count > 2;
SELECT id, expense_date, category FROM expenses ORDER BY category ASC, expense_date DESC;
SELECT * FROM expenses WHERE expense_amount > 100 AND category = 'Food' ORDER BY id DESC;
SELECT id, expense_date, expense_amount FROM expenses WHERE category IN ('Grocery', 'Utilities') ORDER BY expense_date ASC;
SELECT SUM(expense_amount) AS total_expenses, category FROM expenses GROUP BY category HAVING total_expenses > 500;
SELECT category, COUNT(*) AS num_expenses FROM expenses GROUP BY category ORDER BY num_expenses DESC;
SELECT * FROM expenses WHERE expense_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-12-31' AND category LIKE 'En%' ORDER BY expense_date DESC;
SELECT * FROM expenses WHERE amount > 100
SELECT category, amount FROM expenses ORDER BY date DESC
SELECT id, category FROM expenses WHERE category = 'Food'
SELECT * FROM trends WHERE prediction_date BETWEEN '2023-01-01' AND '2023-12-31'
SELECT id, category, amount FROM expenses WHERE category LIKE '%Grocery%'
SELECT category, amount FROM expenses WHERE amount > 100 ORDER BY date DESC
SELECT * FROM expenses WHERE category = 'Food' AND date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-03-31'
SELECT category, SUM(amount) AS total_amount FROM expenses GROUP BY category HAVING SUM(amount) > 500 ORDER BY total_amount DESC
SELECT e.category, e.amount, t.trend_value FROM expenses e JOIN trends t ON e.category = t.category WHERE t.prediction_date = '2022-06-30'
SELECT category, COUNT(*) AS total_count FROM expenses GROUP BY category HAVING COUNT(*) > 2 ORDER BY total_count DESC
SELECT * FROM expenses ORDER BY expense_amount DESC;
SELECT expense_id, expense_date, category FROM expenses WHERE category = 'Food' ORDER BY expense_date ASC;
SELECT trend_name, trend_description FROM trends WHERE trend_description IS NOT NULL;
SELECT forecast_date, forecast_amount FROM forecasts WHERE forecast_amount > 1000;
SELECT expense_date, category, expense_amount FROM expenses WHERE expense_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-01-31';
SELECT * FROM expenses WHERE expense_amount > 1000 ORDER BY expense_date DESC;
SELECT trend_name, trend_description FROM trends WHERE LENGTH(trend_description) > 50;
SELECT forecast_date, forecast_amount, trend_name FROM forecasts JOIN trends ON forecasts.trend_id = trends.trend_id;
SELECT category, SUM(expense_amount) AS total_expenses FROM expenses GROUP BY category HAVING total_expenses > 5000;
SELECT * FROM forecasts WHERE forecast_amount < (SELECT AVG(forecast_amount) FROM forecasts);
SELECT * FROM expenses;
SELECT expense_id, expense_date FROM expenses WHERE expense_amount > 1000;
SELECT category_name FROM categories WHERE category_id = '123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000';
SELECT * FROM forecast_data WHERE forecast_date < '2023-01-01' ORDER BY forecasted_amount DESC;
SELECT trend_description, trend_date FROM trends WHERE category_id = '123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174002' ORDER BY trend_date ASC;
SELECT * FROM expenses WHERE expense_amount > 1000;
SELECT * FROM categories ORDER BY category_name DESC;
SELECT expense_date, SUM(expense_amount) FROM expenses GROUP BY expense_date;
SELECT category_name, forecasted_amount FROM categories c JOIN forecast_data f ON c.category_id = f.category_id WHERE forecasted_amount > 5000 ORDER BY category_name ASC;
SELECT trend_description FROM trends WHERE trend_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-12-31';
SELECT * FROM expenses;
SELECT expense_id, expense_date, expense_amount FROM expenses WHERE category = 'Food';
SELECT * FROM past_expenses ORDER BY past_date DESC;
SELECT category, SUM(expense_amount) AS total_expenses FROM expenses GROUP BY category;
SELECT forecast_id, forecast_date, forecast_amount FROM forecasts WHERE forecast_amount > 1000;
SELECT * FROM expenses WHERE category = 'Groceries';
SELECT expense_date, expense_amount FROM expenses ORDER BY expense_amount DESC;
SELECT AVG(expense_amount) AS average_amount FROM expenses;
SELECT category, COUNT(*) AS total_count FROM expenses GROUP BY category;
SELECT * FROM forecasts WHERE forecast_amount > 1000 ORDER BY forecast_date DESC;
